thread.title: Aluminum Extends Sanction-Driven Gains

author: David Hodari
title: Aluminum Extends Sanction-Driven Gains
text:
Aluminum prices extended last weekâ€™s run up Monday, continuing to get a boost from recent U.S. sanctions on Russian entities.
Aluminum for delivery in three months on the London Metal Exchange climbed 5% to $2,399.00 a metric ton. Prices have climbed to their highest level since 2012 and last week staged their largest rally in more than 30 years, as Russia is one of the largest suppliers of the metal.
